definition: next office holder/next to serve
down/downwards/below/lower/later/next (week etc)/second (of two parts)/to decline/to go down/to arrive at (a decision, conclusion etc)/measure word to show the frequency of an action
surname Ren/Ren County 任縣|任县[Ren2 Xian4] in Hebei

to assign/to appoint/to take up a post/office/responsibility/to let/to allow/to give free rein to/no matter (how, what etc)/classifier for terms served in office, or for spouses, girlfriends etc (as in 前任男友)

sentences.english: Reinforcing a special American-Indian relationship should be a strategic priority of the next U.S. president.
sentences.chinese: 鞏固特殊的美印關係應該是美國下任總統的戰略重點。

sentences.english: An interregnum could prove perilous for the next Dalai Lama as well.
sentences.chinese: 下任達賴喇嘛位置的空缺也能夠被證明是危險的。

sentences.english: However, the survey finds a sharp racial divide over who the next president will be.
sentences.chinese: 但有關誰將成爲下任總統問題的看法卻存在明顯分歧。

sentences.english: The Chief Secretary was an ideal candidate to be the territory's next Chief Executive.
sentences.chinese: 政務司司長是下任特首的理想人選。

sentences.english: Can the next president do anything to avoid that outcome?
sentences.chinese: 那麼下任總統能做點什麼來防止這一局面嗎？

sentences.english: The next American president is likely to be far more co-operative over tackling climate change than George Bush.
sentences.chinese: 在應對氣候變化方面，下任美國總統可能比布什合作。

sentences.english: The next President's hardest job may be getting the country used to that.
sentences.chinese: 下任總統最艱難的工作可能就是讓美國習慣這個事實。

sentences.english: The President designated Mr.Sharp as the next Secretary of State.
sentences.chinese: 總統任命夏普先生爲下任國務卿。

sentences.english: Mr Lee as the next president.
sentences.chinese: 他們選定李先生爲下任主席。

sentences.english: They make choice of mr lee as the next president.
sentences.chinese: 他們選定李先生爲下任主席。

sentences.english: A reversal of that pattern could help the next president.
sentences.chinese: 若能扭轉這一局面，那可能對下任總統有所裨益。

definition: newly-appointed/newly elected/new (in a political office)
to succeed sb in a job/successor
to take over (as minister, manager etc)
next office holder/next to serve
heir/successor
to take over/to take control
choice of person/candidate
to set one's heart on/to set one's choice on
successor
to replace/to take over (a position or post)
to take office/to assume a post
to select sb for a position without announcing the decision until later/to decide behind closed doors/all cut and dried
head of a household
to wield (power etc)
to continue in (a political) office/to serve for another term of office
successor
